physical_appearance:The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features three ladies. All of them are dressed in their ethnic costumes. The lady on the right hand side of the photograph is looking at the two ladies
 who are looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. They are holding books and handkerchiefs in their hands.

sgcool_label_text:This photograph shows three nyonyas or Eurasian women holding books and handkerchiefs in their hands. The photograph on the verso shows a group of people gathered for a festival parade. \r\n\r\nWith continuous improvement of camera technology
 it became possible to take photographs outside a studio in the first decades of the 20th century. Many middle-class families collected photographs in albums as a way of documenting family life
 or documentasi keluarga.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows three nyonyas or Eurasian women holding books and handkerchiefs in their hands. The photograph on the verso shows a group of people gathered for a festival parade. 

With continuous improvement of camera technology, it became possible to take photographs outside a studio in the first decades of the 20th century. Many middle-class families collected photographs in albums as a way of documenting family life, or documentasi keluarga.
